text: Currently I am updating my ratebeer with al the beers I drank but was too lazy to rate at the time. I give the scores I gave back than. If I drink the beers again I might re-rate them.

Almost clear amber, a light booze haze obscures slightly, with a thin off white covering. Nose is light booze, grain, rubber, bitter tropical notes, burnt toffee, raw sugars. Taste comprises lightly singed caramel goo, straw, unrefined cane sugar, dark fruit tang, grain. Medium bodied with bite, moderate carbonation, light warming boozey fuzz in the execution.
Keg at Beer Temple. Pours hazy amber, nose is malty, bready, taste is sweet caramel, dry.

On tap @ Cask Pub & Kitchen. Really cloudy in the glass this and it has a lovely deep amber almost reddish colored body with a medium sized dense and lacing white top. It smells of red currants really. Some faint blackcurrants also here and a little bit of brett. Fruity and fresh definitely. It had a just above average carbonation level and a light oily mouthfeel. Much the same in the taste really. Fruity slightly acidic or perhaps a bit tart in youd like. Yeasty and somewhat sweet as well. Having a hard time identifying the genre here. It definitely has a strong alco sting also. No idea what Im drinking here, but its one of the weakest Ive had from these guys. 09.11.2013

Keg at CBC Islington - London. Pours clear gold with a foamy white head. Rich and malty with lots of bread and honey character. Medium to full bodied with fine carbonation Lightly warming in the finish with mildly harsh alcohol, more honey, bread, slight hay. Very good for the style.

Cask and Kitchen, Pimlico, UK.
Cask, 181013.
Amber with small head. Aroma of caramel. Flavor with alcohol abd malt
Draught @ Beer Temple. Clear amber color, medium sized beige head. Not a lot of aroma. Taste malts, alcohol, sweetness, but also a light touch of bitter. Medium body, average carbonation.
Alcoholic malty beer. Watery and piss-like golden. Why do they make these beers?

From tap at Biertempel. Pours clear and golden amber to dark orange, small, dense and creamy off white head. Aroma is oasted malty, light caramelish. Bitter, dry caramelish and solid malt flavoured. Bitter and dry malty finish.

Draft at Beer Temple. Pours clear amber with a cream head. Aroma of caramel, brown sugar, floral aspects. Flavour is over moderate sweet and bitter. Light medium bodied with soft carbonation, not bad for such a terrible style.
Draught at Beer Temple. Clear red/orange with a medium white head. Medium body with moderate carbonation. Sweet with a bitter finish. Caramel, dark fruit and grains. Ok, but nothing special.

[10/12/13] Draught at Beer Temple in Amsterdam. Clear amber. Aroma of sweet malt, graininess and caramel. Sweet flavor, malty, grainy, caramelly and honey-ish with a bitter finish with some hops and lots of alcohol. Medium-bodied.
Poured medium amber with a frothy off white head. Aroma of soft sweet grains, alcohol soaked berries. Medium to full body, flavour of sweet berries, bitter sweet end.

On tap at PSBH, Manchester. Murky orange/brown shade with a compact head on top. Aroma displays some nice spicy, orange citrussy notes. Sticky mouthfeel with a deep malty taste; plenty of rye spice in there. I quite enjoyed this and I finally got to tick malt liquor.

On tap at Beer Temple. Clear deep amber colour, white head. Aroma of sweet caramel, toast, alcohol. Flavour is sweet, malty, caramel, light spicy, sharp and strong cheap alcohol finish. Light-bodied. OK I guess.

Draught @ Craft Beer Co - Islington, 55 White Lion Street, Islington, Greater London, England N1 9PP.Clear medium red - orange amber colour with a small to average, frothy, fair lacing, mostly diminishing, off-white head. Aroma is moderate malty, caramel, fruity malt, sweet malt, light to moderate hoppy. Flavor is moderate to light light heavy sweet and moderate bitter with a long duration, sweet malt, fruity malt, spicy sweet. Body is medium, texture is oily, carbonation is soft. [20130807]

Keg. Clear amber orange with a thin white head. Smell is weird - like eggy sulphurous sherry. Taste is malty, warming, slight apple, sherry, coins - really quite metallic. Medium body and low carbonation. Its OK. (note, Ive had to increase the aroma score in order to give this a fair rating - real aroma score 2)

Keg at the Cask, Pimlico, 08/10/13.
Almost clear amber, a light booze haze obscures slightly, with a thin off white covering.
Nose is light booze, grain, rubber, bitter tropical notes, burnt toffee, raw sugars.
Taste comprises lightly singed caramel goo, straw, unrefined cane sugar, dark fruit tang, grain.
Medium bodied with bite, moderate carbonation, light warming boozey fuzz in the execution.
A Rolls Royce of the Malt Liqour world!
user_location: Hazlemere, the lower Xhitlerns, Buckinghamshire, ENGLAND

text: Keg at Cask Pub & Kitchen. It pours hazy amber with a small white head. The nose is sweet, brown bread, corn, metallic twang and spicy edge. The taste is sweet, caramel, bruised fruit, bread, zesty orange, light veg, toast, corn, grass, spice and mild bitterness with a dry finish. Medium body, sticky and fine, prickly carbonation. Actually not too bad. A grade-A malt liquor.

Draft @ Craft Beer Co, Islington N1. Pours a hazy orange color with a small white head. Has a fruity malty spicy caramel aroma with weak hoppy hints. Sweetish malty weak spicy caramel flavor. Has a sweetish malty spicy caramel finish.

27th August 2013Craft Islington. Hazy amber beer, little white head. Palate is smooth with a fine crispy carbonation. Little sulphur on the nose. It carries over to the taste, mild though. Bruised oranges and a pinch of spice. Creamy malt and a light lime tang. Finishes semi dry. Clunky and too much like hard work.

The Sampler, Brooklyn tap: Pours red with a whitish head. Aroma is slightly hoppy, a little of booze, some distinct malt liquor smells.Taste is similar. Somewhat bitter. Malty and toasty. Vaguely tastes like malt liquor, but really not so much, because this is quality beer beverage.
Tap at Craft Islington. Dark amber colour, not much head. Aroma is funky, toffee and caramel, slight cherry smell. Taste is similar, caramel, slightly fruity. Pretty good for my malt liquor tick.
I suppose if you consider it a malt liquor it is the top of its style. A hearty malt-heavy lager.

Draft. Clear amber. Off-white head. Aroma of raw grain, rye, vinegar, caramel, corn. The flavor is moderately sweet and lightly bitter. It finishes lightly to moderately sweet and lightly to moderately bitter. Medium body, sticky texture, soft carbonation. Grainy and rough. Rye and alcohol taste.

1600th rating! A malt liquor! Hell yea! Pours a clear golden with little head. Nose is mostly apple with touches of flakes corn nuts. Apple, white grape, dry hay and touches of corn. Has at bite at first but simmers down on the second taste.

Aroma of corn, rye, apple and hard candy. Appearance is light copper with sticky off white head. Flavor is corn and rye dominant; the rye makes this all quite palatable and tasty; the finish is the typical malt liquor tang. Palate is medium, creamy and soft. The hommies would be more than satisfied.
Bottle.  Cherry and rye aroma.  Amber with small head.  Sweet rye malt flavor with a hint of cherry.  Bitter quinine finish.  Not bad (high praise for a malt liquor).

Draught at Country Boy. No ABV on board. I asked on Facebook what the ABV was, and ATG said: METAL. Ok. Malty sweet with significant alcohol presence. I believe this is a rye with malt liquor. Nice but interesting.
